back_cards.example_en: The train was late by ten minutes.

back_cards.definition_en: Occurring toward the end of a period
back_cards.example_en: She called during the late afternoon.
The late author’s book was published posthumously.
He submitted his homework late.
Her late decision changed the outcome.

back_cards.definition_en: A public road in a city
back_cards.example_en: The shop is on Main Street.

back_cards.definition_en: A place for pedestrians and vehicles
back_cards.example_en: Kids were playing in the street.
This street is known for its cafés.
He grew up on the streets.
The parade marched down the street.
The concert in the park was free.
She felt free after finishing her exams.
Is this seat free for me to take?
You’re free to leave anytime.
The road is free of traffic now.

back_cards.definition_en: To a greater degree or extent
back_cards.example_en: She sings better than anyone I know.
He works better under pressure.
This explains it better than the book.
The team played better today.
She’s feeling better after resting.
Everyone enjoyed the party last night.
Everyone please take a seat.
Everyone in town knows the story.
Everyone loves a good movie.
Everyone voted in the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: A plan or course of action
back_cards.example_en: The company updated its return policy.
The new policy supports renewable energy.
School policy requires uniforms.
Their policy is to hire locally.
Her policy covers medical expenses.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of furniture with a flat top
back_cards.example_en: We sat around the kitchen table.

back_cards.definition_en: A chart or list of data
back_cards.example_en: The table shows sales figures.
The issue is on the table for debate.
She set a beautiful table for dinner.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of people at an event
back_cards.example_en: Our table was next to the stage.
I’m sorry for being late.
She felt sorry for the lost puppy.

back_cards.definition_en: In a poor or regrettable state
back_cards.example_en: The house was in a sorry condition.
Sorry, I can’t help you today.
He gave a sorry smile after losing.
She cares deeply about the environment.

back_cards.definition_en: To provide for or look after
back_cards.example_en: He cares for his elderly parents.
I don’t care which movie we watch.
Care for your belongings in the crowd.
She cares for the garden every morning.
The bridge has a low clearance.
The battery is running low.
She spoke in a low voice.
He’s been feeling low lately.
They offered a low price for the car.
Every human deserves respect.
Humans evolved over millions of years.

back_cards.definition_en: A being with emotions and flaws
back_cards.example_en: To err is human, she reminded him.
The study focuses on human behavior.
Humans shape the world around them.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to make a polite request
back_cards.example_en: Please close the door.
Help yourself, please.
Please, tell me more about it.
Please be quiet during the movie.
Come in, please, and take a seat.

back_cards.definition_en: To wish for something to happen
back_cards.example_en: I hope it doesn’t rain this afternoon.
She hopes to pass her driving test.
We hope for peace in the region.
He hoped his team would win.
They hope to travel the world.
Her story turned out to be true.
He showed true courage in the crisis.
She’s a true friend who always helps.
The map is true to the terrain.
His words rang true during the speech.

back_cards.definition_en: A series of actions or steps
back_cards.example_en: The hiring process takes two weeks.
The process for making cheese is complex.
Healing is a slow process.
The court process was lengthy.
The process ensures quality control.
The teacher explained the math problem.
Her coach was also her teacher in life.
The teacher prepared a fun lesson plan.
Books can be great teachers.
The teacher inspired her students to read.
The data supports the new theory.
She analyzed the data on her computer.
The lab data was inconclusive.
The data shows a rise in sales.
We need more data to decide.
They offered her a job at the firm.
The café offers free Wi-Fi.
He offered to help with the move.
She offered her seat to the elderly man.
The house was offered at a low price.
His death was a shock to the family.
The cause of death was unknown.
The soldier faced death bravely.
The scandal was the death of his career.
Stories often depict Death as a figure.
She ate the whole pizza by herself.
The whole team agreed on the plan.
The whole town came to the festival.
The vase remained whole after the fall.
The whole process took two hours.
Her experience in sales helped her succeed.
The trip was an amazing experience.
He has ten years of teaching experience.
She shared her experience of moving abroad.

back_cards.definition_en: The process of living through something
back_cards.example_en: Life experience shapes our views.
They made a plan for the vacation.
Her plan is to study medicine.
The architect drew a plan for the house.
The project plan spans six months.

back_cards.definition_en: A method to achieve a goal
back_cards.example_en: The business plan attracted investors.
The recipe was easy to follow.
He has an easy manner with strangers.
It’s an easy walk to the park.
The app has an easy interface.
She leads an easy life in the countryside.
Education is key to personal growth.
She pursued higher education at college.
His education prepared him for the job.
The country reformed its education system.

back_cards.definition_en: A field of study or work
back_cards.example_en: She works in education policy.
They plan to build a new house.
She built a successful career in tech.
He’s working to build his confidence.
They built a strong friendship over time.
The kids built a sandcastle on the beach.

back_cards.definition_en: To anticipate or look forward to
back_cards.example_en: I expect the package to arrive tomorrow.
She expects to finish the project soon.
The teacher expects us to study daily.
He didn’t expect the test to be so hard.
They expect good news from the doctor.
The leaves fall from the trees in autumn.
He fell while climbing the stairs.
The temperature fell overnight.
The holiday falls on a Monday.
The plan fell apart at the last minute.
He taught himself how to code.

back_cards.definition_en: For emphasis on a male subject
back_cards.example_en: He himself made the decision.
He hurt himself while skating.
He kept the secret to himself.
He bought himself a new jacket.
She’s reaching the age of 30.
The Stone Age was fascinating.
He’s at an age where he’s curious.
The game is suitable for all ages.
Age has brought her wisdom.

back_cards.definition_en: Firm or solid to the touch
back_cards.example_en: The ground was hard after the frost.
The math test was really hard.
She worked hard to earn her degree.
He faced hard criticism for his choice.
It was a hard hit during the game.
Her sense of smell is very sharp.
I had a sense something was wrong.
She has a good sense of humor.
The decision made sense to everyone.
He lacked a sense of direction.
She swam across the river.
The news spread across the country.
I came across an old friend today.
Poverty exists across all regions.
The store is across the street.
She showed her artwork at the gallery.
He showed how to fix the bike.
The usher showed us to our seats.
Her talent shows in her writing.
The channel shows movies every night.
She arrived early for the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: Near the beginning of a period
back_cards.example_en: The early years of her life were tough.
I prefer early workouts.
The flowers bloomed early this year.
Early computers were massive.
She’s attending college next fall.
He graduated from a medical college.
College was the best time of her life.
The college of arts offers many courses.
The college has a strong science program.
She listens to music while studying.
Jazz music is popular in this club.
He’s studying music at school.
The music for the song was complex.
Music brings people together at festivals.
The sun appeared from behind the clouds.
She appears confident in her speech.
He appeared at the party unexpectedly.
Her article appeared in the magazine.
The band appeared on a TV show.
Her mind is sharp and creative.
His mind was on the upcoming exam.
She changed her mind about the trip.
The song brought back memories to mind.
He’s in a peaceful state of mind.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of students learning together
back_cards.example_en: The class meets every Monday.
She’s taking a history class.
The middle class grew in the city.
This hotel is in a higher class.
Her work shows real class and elegance.
The police responded to the emergency call.
The police patrolled the festival.
Campus police ensured student safety.
The police investigated the robbery.
He reported the issue to the police.
